name: Midsummer Night
description: Waking up after a nap one warm July afternoon, Klim finds out that his sister Alionushka has left the house earlier. He goes looking for her, with an aim to visit the great festival of Midsummer together later that day. However, an unlikely event changes everything...

reviews.review_text: 'Midsummer Night' is a beautiful, little indie gem. It tells an interesting tale (probably based on Russian folklore), features great pixel art, a decent soundtrack and plays with your emotions. It ranges from eery, dark and gloomy to heartwarming and touching. Taking around 2 hours to complete, achievements suggest that there is way more to do and explore than I actually did during the 1st playthrough,  so there definitely is some replay value here. I absolutely enjoyed playing 'Midsummer Night' and was sucked in by it's charm immediately. If you like pixel graphics and nice story-telling, this game is for you!

Its a very short but sweet game with little horror. I am surprised with the way they created the fairy tale atmosphere using mere pixel graphics. I got this game for 25 Indian Rupees. Its a Thumbs up from me. I recommend this game for the ones looking for foresty/flowery atmosphere.
